00010 /* for dgCMatrix  _and_ lgCMatrix and others  (but *not*  ngC...) : */
00011 SEXP xCMatrix_validate(SEXP x)
00012 {
00013     /* Almost everything now in Csparse_validate ( ./Csparse.c )
00014      * *but* the checking of the 'x' slot : */
00015     if (length(GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_iSym)) !=
00016         length(GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_xSym)))
00017         return mkString(_("lengths of slots 'i' and 'x' must match"));
00018 
00019     return ScalarLogical(1);
00020 }
00021 
00022 /* for dgRMatrix  _and_ lgRMatrix and others  (but *not*  ngC...) : */
00023 SEXP xRMatrix_validate(SEXP x)
00024 {
00025     /* Almost everything now in Rsparse_validate ( ./Csparse.c )
00026      * *but* the checking of the 'x' slot : */
00027     if (length(GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_jSym)) !=
00028         length(GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_xSym)))
00029         return mkString(_("lengths of slots 'j' and 'x' must match"));
00030 
00031     return ScalarLogical(1);
00032 }

00034 /* This and the following R_to_CMatrix() lead to memory-not-mapped seg.faults
00035  * only with {32bit + R-devel + enable-R-shlib} -- no idea why */
00036 SEXP compressed_to_TMatrix(SEXP x, SEXP colP)
00037 {
00038     int col = asLogical(colP); /* 1 if "C"olumn compressed;  0 if "R"ow */
00039     /* however, for Csparse, we now effectively use the cholmod-based
00040      * Csparse_to_Tsparse() in ./Csparse.c ; maybe should simply write
00041      * an  as_cholmod_Rsparse() function and then do "as there" ...*/
00042     SEXP indSym = col ? Matrix_iSym : Matrix_jSym,
00043         ans,    indP = GET_SLOT(x, indSym),
00044         pP = GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_pSym);
00045     int npt = length(pP) - 1;
00046     char *ncl = strdup(class_P(x));
00047     char *valid[] = {
00048         "dgCMatrix", "dsCMatrix", "dtCMatrix", /* 0: 0:2 */
00049         "lgCMatrix", "lsCMatrix", "ltCMatrix", /* 1: 3:5 */
00050         "ngCMatrix", "nsCMatrix", "ntCMatrix", /* 2: 6:8 */
00051         "zgCMatrix", "zsCMatrix", "ztCMatrix", /* 3: 9:11 */
00052 
00053         "dgRMatrix", "dsRMatrix", "dtRMatrix", /* 4: 12:14 */
00054         "lgRMatrix", "lsRMatrix", "ltRMatrix", /* 5: 15:17 */
00055         "ngRMatrix", "nsRMatrix", "ntRMatrix", /* 6: 18:20 */
00056         "zgRMatrix", "zsRMatrix", "ztRMatrix", /* 7: 21:23 */
00057         ""};
00058     int ctype = Matrix_check_class_etc(x, valid);
00059 
00060     if (ctype < 0)
00061         error(_("invalid class(x) '%s' in compressed_to_TMatrix(x)"), ncl);
00062 
00063     /* replace 'C' or 'R' with 'T' :*/
00064     ncl[2] = 'T';
00065     ans = PROTECT(NEW_OBJECT(MAKE_CLASS(ncl)));
00066 
00067     slot_dup(ans, x, Matrix_DimSym);
00068     if((ctype / 3) % 4 != 2) /* not n..Matrix */
00069         slot_dup(ans, x, Matrix_xSym);
00070     if(ctype % 3) { /* s(ymmetric) or t(riangular) : */
00071         slot_dup(ans, x, Matrix_uploSym);
00072         if(ctype % 3 == 2) /* t(riangular) : */
00073             slot_dup(ans, x, Matrix_diagSym);
00074     }
00075     SET_DimNames(ans, x);
00076     SET_SLOT(ans, indSym, duplicate(indP));
00077     expand_cmprPt(npt, INTEGER(pP),
00078                   INTEGER(ALLOC_SLOT(ans, col ? Matrix_jSym : Matrix_iSym,
00079                                      INTSXP, length(indP))));
00080     free(ncl);
00081     UNPROTECT(1);
00082     return ans;
00083 }
00084 
00085 SEXP R_to_CMatrix(SEXP x)
00086 {
00087     SEXP ans, tri = PROTECT(allocVector(LGLSXP, 1));
00088     char *ncl = strdup(class_P(x));
00089     char *valid[] = {
00090         "dgRMatrix", "dsRMatrix", "dtRMatrix",
00091         "lgRMatrix", "lsRMatrix", "ltRMatrix",
00092         "ngRMatrix", "nsRMatrix", "ntRMatrix",
00093         "zgRMatrix", "zsRMatrix", "ztRMatrix",
00094         ""};
00095     int ctype = Matrix_check_class_etc(x, valid);
00096     int *x_dims = INTEGER(GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_DimSym)), *a_dims;
00097     PROTECT_INDEX ipx;
00098 
00099     if (ctype < 0)
00100         error(_("invalid class(x) '%s' in R_to_CMatrix(x)"), ncl);
00101 
00102     /* replace 'R' with 'C' : */
00103     ncl[2] = 'C';
00104     PROTECT_WITH_INDEX(ans = NEW_OBJECT(MAKE_CLASS(ncl)), &ipx);
00105 
00106     a_dims = INTEGER(ALLOC_SLOT(ans, Matrix_DimSym, INTSXP, 2));
00107     /* reversed dim() since we will transpose: */
00108     a_dims[0] = x_dims[1];
00109     a_dims[1] = x_dims[0];
00110 
00111     /* triangular: */ LOGICAL(tri)[0] = 0;
00112     if((ctype / 3) != 2) /* not n..Matrix */
00113         slot_dup(ans, x, Matrix_xSym);
00114     if(ctype % 3) { /* s(ymmetric) or t(riangular) : */
00115         SET_SLOT(ans, Matrix_uploSym,
00116                  mkString((*uplo_P(x) == 'U') ? "L" : "U"));
00117         if(ctype % 3 == 2) { /* t(riangular) : */
00118             LOGICAL(tri)[0] = 1;
00119             slot_dup(ans, x, Matrix_diagSym);
00120         }
00121     }
00122     SET_SLOT(ans, Matrix_iSym, duplicate(GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_jSym)));
00123     slot_dup(ans, x, Matrix_pSym);
00124     REPROTECT(ans = Csparse_transpose(ans, tri), ipx);
00125     SET_DimNames(ans, x);
00126     free(ncl);
00127     UNPROTECT(2);
00128     return ans;
00129 }
00130 
00131 SEXP compressed_non_0_ij(SEXP x, SEXP colP)
00132 {
00133     int col = asLogical(colP); /* 1 if "C"olumn compressed;  0 if "R"ow */
00134     SEXP ans, indSym = col ? Matrix_iSym : Matrix_jSym;
00135     SEXP indP = GET_SLOT(x, indSym),
00136         pP = GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_pSym);
00137     int i, *ij;
00138     int ncol = INTEGER(GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_DimSym))[1],
00139         n_el = INTEGER(pP)[ncol]; /* is only == length(indP), if the
00140                                      i-slot is not over-allocated */
00141 
00142     ij = INTEGER(ans = PROTECT(allocMatrix(INTSXP, n_el, 2)));
00143     /* expand the compressed margin to 'i' or 'j' : */
00144     expand_cmprPt(ncol, INTEGER(pP), &ij[col ? n_el : 0]);
00145     /* and copy the other one: */
00146     if (col)
00147         for(i = 0; i < n_el; i++)
00148             ij[i] = INTEGER(indP)[i];
00149     else /* row compressed */
00150         for(i = 0; i < n_el; i++)
00151             ij[i + n_el] = INTEGER(indP)[i];
00152 
00153     UNPROTECT(1);
00154     return ans;
00155 }

00158 SEXP dgCMatrix_lusol(SEXP x, SEXP y)
00159 {

00161                        duplicate(y) : coerceVector(y, REALSXP));
00162     CSP xc = AS_CSP__(x);
00163     R_CheckStack();
00164 
00165     if (xc->m != xc->n || xc->m <= 0)
00166         error(_("dgCMatrix_lusol requires a square, non-empty matrix"));
00167     if (LENGTH(ycp) != xc->m)
00168         error(_("Dimensions of system to be solved are inconsistent"));
00169     if (!cs_lusol(/*order*/ 1, xc, REAL(ycp), /*tol*/ 1e-7))
00170         error(_("cs_lusol failed"));
00171 
00172     UNPROTECT(1);
00173     return ycp;
00174 }

00177 SEXP dgCMatrix_qrsol(SEXP x, SEXP y, SEXP ord)
00178 {
00179     /* FIXME: extend this to work in multivariate case, i.e. y a matrix with > 1 column ! */
00180     SEXP ycp = PROTECT((TYPEOF(y) == REALSXP) ?
00181                        duplicate(y) : coerceVector(y, REALSXP));
00182     CSP xc = AS_CSP(x); /* <--> x  may be  dgC* or dtC* */
00183     int order = INTEGER(ord)[0];
00184 #ifdef _not_yet_do_FIXME__
00185     const char *nms[] = {"L", "coef", "Xty", "resid", ""};
00186     SEXP ans = PROTECT(Matrix_make_named(VECSXP, nms));
00187 #endif
00188     R_CheckStack();
00189 
00190     if (order < 0 || order > 3)
00191         error(_("dgCMatrix_qrsol(., order) needs order in {0,..,3}"));
00192     /* --> cs_amd()  ---  order 0: natural, 1: Chol, 2: LU, 3: QR */
00193     if (LENGTH(ycp) != xc->m)
00194         error(_("Dimensions of system to be solved are inconsistent"));
00195     /* FIXME?  Note that qr_sol() would allow *under-determined systems;
00196      *          In general, we'd need  LENGTH(ycp) = max(n,m)
00197      * FIXME also: multivariate y (see above)
00198      */
00199     if (xc->m < xc->n || xc->n <= 0)
00200         error(_("dgCMatrix_qrsol(<%d x %d>-matrix) requires a 'tall' rectangular matrix"),
00201                 xc->m, xc->n);
00202 
00203     /* cs_qrsol(): Tim Davis (2006) .. "8.2 Using a QR factorization", p.136f , calling
00204      * -------      cs_sqr(order, ..), see  p.76 */
00205     /* MM: FIXME: write our *OWN* version of - the first case (m >= n) - of cs_qrsol()
00206      * ---------  which will  (1) work with a *multivariate* y
00207      *                        (2) compute coefficients properly, not overwriting RHS
00208      */
00209     if (!cs_qrsol(order, xc, REAL(ycp)))
00210         /* return value really is 0 or 1 - no more info there */
00211         error(_("cs_qrsol() failed inside dgCMatrix_qrsol()"));
00212 
00213     /* Solution is only in the first part of ycp -- cut its length back to n : */
00214     {
00215         SEXP nms = getAttrib(ycp, R_NamesSymbol);
00216         SETLENGTH(ycp, xc->n);
00217         if(nms != R_NilValue) {
00218             SETLENGTH(nms, xc->n);
00219             setAttrib(ycp, R_NamesSymbol, nms);
00220         }
00221     }
00222     UNPROTECT(1);
00223     return ycp;
00224 }
00225 
00226 /* Modified version of Tim Davis's cs_qr_mex.c file for MATLAB */
00227 SEXP dgCMatrix_QR(SEXP Ap, SEXP order)
00228 {
00229     SEXP ans = PROTECT(NEW_OBJECT(MAKE_CLASS("sparseQR")));
00230     CSP A = AS_CSP__(Ap), D;
00231     css *S;
00232     csn *N;
00233     int m = A->m, n = A->n, ord = asLogical(order) ? 3 : 0, *p;
00234     int *dims = INTEGER(ALLOC_SLOT(ans, Matrix_DimSym, INTSXP, 2));
00235     R_CheckStack();
00236 
00237     if (m < n) error(_("A must have #{rows} >= #{columns}")) ;
00238     dims[0] = m; dims[1] = n;
00239     S = cs_sqr(ord, A, 1);      /* symbolic QR ordering & analysis*/
00240     if (!S) error(_("cs_sqr failed"));
00241     N = cs_qr(A, S);            /* numeric QR factorization */
00242     if (!N) error(_("cs_qr failed")) ;
00243     cs_dropzeros(N->L);         /* drop zeros from V and sort */
00244     D = cs_transpose(N->L, 1);
00245     cs_spfree(N->L);
00246     N->L = cs_transpose(D, 1);
00247     cs_spfree(D);
00248     cs_dropzeros(N->U);         /* drop zeros from R and sort */
00249     D = cs_transpose(N->U, 1);
00250     cs_spfree(N->U) ;
00251     N->U = cs_transpose(D, 1);
00252     cs_spfree(D);
00253     m = N->L->m;                /* m may be larger now */
00254     p = cs_pinv(S->pinv, m);    /* p = pinv' */
00255     SET_SLOT(ans, install("V"),
00256              Matrix_cs_to_SEXP(N->L, "dgCMatrix", 0));
00257     Memcpy(REAL(ALLOC_SLOT(ans, install("beta"),
00258                            REALSXP, n)), N->B, n);
00259     Memcpy(INTEGER(ALLOC_SLOT(ans, Matrix_pSym,
00260                               INTSXP, m)), p, m);
00261     SET_SLOT(ans, install("R"),
00262              Matrix_cs_to_SEXP(N->U, "dgCMatrix", 0));
00263     if (ord)
00264         Memcpy(INTEGER(ALLOC_SLOT(ans, install("q"),
00265                                   INTSXP, n)), S->q, n);
00266     else
00267         ALLOC_SLOT(ans, install("q"), INTSXP, 0);
00268     cs_nfree(N);
00269     cs_sfree(S);
00270     cs_free(p);
00271     UNPROTECT(1);
00272     return ans;
00273 }

00296 SEXP dgCMatrix_SPQR(SEXP Ap, SEXP ordering, SEXP econ, SEXP tol)
00297 {
00298 /* SEXP ans = PROTECT(allocVector(VECSXP, 4)); */
00299     SEXP ans = PROTECT(NEW_OBJECT(MAKE_CLASS("SPQR")));
00300 
00301     CHM_SP A = AS_CHM_SP(Ap), Q, R;
00302     UF_long *E, rank;/* not always = int   FIXME  (Windows_64 ?) */
00303 
00304     if ((rank = SuiteSparseQR_C_QR(asInteger(ordering),
00305                                    asReal(tol),/* originally had SPQR_DEFAULT_TOL */
00306                                    (UF_long)asInteger(econ),/* originally had 0 */
00307                                    A, &Q, &R, &E, &c)) == -1)
00308         error(_("SuiteSparseQR_C_QR returned an error code"));
00309 
00310     SET_SLOT(ans, Matrix_DimSym, duplicate(GET_SLOT(Ap, Matrix_DimSym)));
00311 /*     SET_VECTOR_ELT(ans, 0, */
00312 /*                 chm_sparse_to_SEXP(Q, 0, 0, 0, "", R_NilValue)); */
00313     SET_SLOT(ans, install("Q"),
00314              chm_sparse_to_SEXP(Q, 0, 0, 0, "", R_NilValue));
00315 
00316     /* Also gives a dgCMatrix (not a dtC* *triangular*) :
00317      * may make sense if to be used in the "spqr_solve" routines .. ?? */
00318 /*     SET_VECTOR_ELT(ans, 1, */
00319 /*                 chm_sparse_to_SEXP(R, 0, 0, 0, "", R_NilValue)); */
00320     SET_SLOT(ans, install("R"),
00321              chm_sparse_to_SEXP(R, 0, 0, 0, "", R_NilValue));
00322     cholmod_l_free_sparse(&R, &c);
00323     cholmod_l_free_sparse(&Q, &c);
00324     if (E) {
00325         /* FIXME when UF_long != int  ?! */
00326         Memcpy(INTEGER(ALLOC_SLOT(ans, Matrix_pSym, /* "p" */
00327                                   INTSXP, A->ncol)), E, A->ncol);
00328 /*      SET_VECTOR_ELT(ans, 2, allocVector(INTSXP, A->ncol)); */
00329 /*      Memcpy(INTEGER(VECTOR_ELT(ans, 2)), E, A->ncol); */
00330         Free(E);
00331     } /* else SET_VECTOR_ELT(ans, 2, allocVector(INTSXP, 0)); */
00332 
00333     SET_SLOT(ans, install("rank"), ScalarInteger((int)rank));
00334     UNPROTECT(1);
00335     return ans;
00336 }

00338 /* Matrix_with_SPQR */

00340 /* Modified version of Tim Davis's cs_lu_mex.c file for MATLAB */
00341 void install_lu(SEXP Ap, int order, double tol, Rboolean err_sing)
00342 {
00343     SEXP ans;
00344     css *S;
00345     csn *N;
00346     int n, *p, *dims;
00347     CSP A = AS_CSP__(Ap), D;
00348     R_CheckStack();
00349 
00350     n = A->n;
00351     if (A->m != n)
00352         error(_("LU decomposition applies only to square matrices"));
00353     if (order) {                /* not using natural order */
00354         order = (tol == 1) ? 2  /* amd(S'*S) w/dense rows or I */
00355             : 1;                /* amd (A+A'), or natural */
00356     }
00357     S = cs_sqr(order, A, 0);    /* symbolic ordering, no QR bound */
00358     N = cs_lu(A, S, tol);       /* numeric factorization */
00359     if (!N) {
00360         if(err_sing)
00361             error(_("cs_lu(A) failed: near-singular A (or out of memory)"));
00362         else {
00363             /* No warning: The useR should be careful :
00364              * Put  FALSE  into  "LU" factor */
00365             set_factors(Ap, ScalarLogical(NA_LOGICAL), "LU");
00366             return;
00367         }
00368     }
00369     cs_dropzeros(N->L);         /* drop zeros from L and sort it */
00370     D = cs_transpose(N->L, 1);
00371     cs_spfree(N->L);
00372     N->L = cs_transpose(D, 1);
00373     cs_spfree(D);
00374     cs_dropzeros(N->U);         /* drop zeros from U and sort it */
00375     D = cs_transpose(N->U, 1);
00376     cs_spfree(N->U);
00377     N->U = cs_transpose(D, 1);
00378     cs_spfree(D);
00379     p = cs_pinv(N->pinv, n);    /* p=pinv' */
00380     ans = PROTECT(NEW_OBJECT(MAKE_CLASS("sparseLU")));
00381     dims = INTEGER(ALLOC_SLOT(ans, Matrix_DimSym, INTSXP, 2));
00382     dims[0] = n; dims[1] = n;
00383     SET_SLOT(ans, install("L"),
00384              Matrix_cs_to_SEXP(N->L, "dtCMatrix", 0));
00385     SET_SLOT(ans, install("U"),
00386              Matrix_cs_to_SEXP(N->U, "dtCMatrix", 0));
00387     Memcpy(INTEGER(ALLOC_SLOT(ans, Matrix_pSym, /* "p" */
00388                               INTSXP, n)), p, n);
00389     if (order)
00390         Memcpy(INTEGER(ALLOC_SLOT(ans, install("q"),
00391                                   INTSXP, n)), S->q, n);
00392     cs_nfree(N);
00393     cs_sfree(S);
00394     cs_free(p);
00395     UNPROTECT(1);
00396     set_factors(Ap, ans, "LU");
00397 }
00398 
00399 SEXP dgCMatrix_LU(SEXP Ap, SEXP orderp, SEXP tolp, SEXP error_on_sing)
00400 {
00401     SEXP ans;
00402     Rboolean err_sing = asLogical(error_on_sing);
00403     /* FIXME: dgCMatrix_LU should check ans for consistency in
00404      * permutation type with the requested value - Should have two
00405      * classes or two different names in the factors list for LU with
00406      * permuted columns or not.
00407      * OTOH, currently  (order, tol) === (1, 1) always.
00408      * It is true that length(LU@q) does flag the order argument.
00409      */
00410     if (!isNull(ans = get_factors(Ap, "LU")))
00411         return ans;
00412     install_lu(Ap, asInteger(orderp), asReal(tolp), err_sing);
00413     return get_factors(Ap, "LU");
00414 }
00415 
00416 SEXP dgCMatrix_matrix_solve(SEXP Ap, SEXP b)
00417 {
00418     SEXP ans = PROTECT(dup_mMatrix_as_dgeMatrix(b)),
00419         lu, qslot;
00420     CSP L, U;
00421     int *bdims = INTEGER(GET_SLOT(ans, Matrix_DimSym)), *p, *q;
00422     int j, n = bdims[0], nrhs = bdims[1];
00423     double *ax = REAL(GET_SLOT(ans, Matrix_xSym)),
00424         *x = Alloca(n, double);
00425     R_CheckStack();
00426 
00427     if (isNull(lu = get_factors(Ap, "LU"))) {
00428         install_lu(Ap, 1, 1.0, /* err_sing = */ TRUE);
00429         lu = get_factors(Ap, "LU");
00430     }
00431     qslot = GET_SLOT(lu, install("q"));
00432     L = AS_CSP__(GET_SLOT(lu, install("L")));
00433     U = AS_CSP__(GET_SLOT(lu, install("U")));
00434     R_CheckStack();
00435 
00436     p = INTEGER(GET_SLOT(lu, Matrix_pSym));
00437     q = LENGTH(qslot) ? INTEGER(qslot) : (int *) NULL;
00438 
00439     if (U->n != n || nrhs < 1 || n < 1)
00440         error(_("Dimensions of system to be solved are inconsistent"));
00441     for (j = 0; j < nrhs; j++) {
00442         cs_pvec(p, ax + j * n, x, n);  /* x = b(p) */
00443         cs_lsolve(L, x);               /* x = L\x */
00444         cs_usolve(U, x);               /* x = U\x */
00445         if (q)                         /* b(q) = x */
00446             cs_ipvec(q, x, ax + j * n, n);
00447         else
00448             Memcpy(ax + j * n, x, n);
00449     }
00450     UNPROTECT(1);
00451     return ans;
00452 }
00453 
00454 SEXP dgCMatrix_cholsol(SEXP x, SEXP y)
00455 {
00456     /* Solve Sparse Least Squares X %*% beta ~= y  with dense RHS y,
00457      * where X = t(x) i.e. we pass  x = t(X)  as argument,
00458      * via  "Cholesky(X'X)" .. well not really:
00459      * cholmod_factorize("x", ..) finds L in  X'X = L'L directly */
00460     CHM_SP cx = AS_CHM_SP(x);
00461     /* FIXME: extend this to work in multivariate case, i.e. y a matrix with > 1 column ! */
00462     CHM_DN cy = AS_CHM_DN(coerceVector(y, REALSXP)), rhs, cAns, resid;
00463     CHM_FR L;
00464     int n = cx->ncol;/* #{obs.} {x = t(X) !} */
00465     double one[] = {1,0}, zero[] = {0,0}, neg1[] = {-1,0};
00466     const char *nms[] = {"L", "coef", "Xty", "resid", ""};
00467     SEXP ans = PROTECT(Matrix_make_named(VECSXP, nms));
00468     R_CheckStack();
00469 
00470     if (n < cx->nrow || n <= 0)
00471         error(_("dgCMatrix_cholsol requires a 'short, wide' rectangular matrix"));
00472     if (cy->nrow != n)
00473         error(_("Dimensions of system to be solved are inconsistent"));
00474     rhs = cholmod_l_allocate_dense(cx->nrow, 1, cx->nrow, CHOLMOD_REAL, &c);
00475     /* cholmod_sdmult(A, transp, alpha, beta, X, Y, &c):
00476      *          Y := alpha*(A*X) + beta*Y or alpha*(A'*X) + beta*Y ;
00477      * here: rhs := 1 * x %*% y + 0 =  x %*% y =  X'y  */
00478     if (!(cholmod_l_sdmult(cx, 0 /* trans */, one, zero, cy, rhs, &c)))
00479         error(_("cholmod_l_sdmult error (rhs)"));
00480     L = cholmod_l_analyze(cx, &c);
00481     if (!cholmod_l_factorize(cx, L, &c))
00482         error(_("cholmod_l_factorize failed: status %d, minor %d from ncol %d"),
00483               c.status, L->minor, L->n);
00484 /* FIXME: Do this in stages so an "effects" vector can be calculated */
00485     if (!(cAns = cholmod_l_solve(CHOLMOD_A, L, rhs, &c)))
00486         error(_("cholmod_l_solve (CHOLMOD_A) failed: status %d, minor %d from ncol %d"),
00487               c.status, L->minor, L->n);
00488     /* L : */
00489     SET_VECTOR_ELT(ans, 0, chm_factor_to_SEXP(L, 0));
00490     /* coef : */
00491     SET_VECTOR_ELT(ans, 1, allocVector(REALSXP, cx->nrow));
00492     Memcpy(REAL(VECTOR_ELT(ans, 1)), (double*)(cAns->x), cx->nrow);
00493     /* X'y : */
00494 /* FIXME: Change this when the "effects" vector is available */
00495     SET_VECTOR_ELT(ans, 2, allocVector(REALSXP, cx->nrow));
00496     Memcpy(REAL(VECTOR_ELT(ans, 2)), (double*)(rhs->x), cx->nrow);
00497     /* resid := y */
00498     resid = cholmod_l_copy_dense(cy, &c);
00499     /* cholmod_sdmult(A, transp, alp, bet, X, Y, &c):
00500      *          Y := alp*(A*X) + bet*Y or alp*(A'*X) + beta*Y ;
00501      * here: resid := -1 * x' %*% coef + 1 * y = y - X %*% coef  */
00502     if (!(cholmod_l_sdmult(cx, 1/* trans */, neg1, one, cAns, resid, &c)))
00503         error(_("cholmod_l_sdmult error (resid)"));
00504     /* FIXME: for multivariate case, i.e. resid  *matrix* with > 1 column ! */
00505     SET_VECTOR_ELT(ans, 3, allocVector(REALSXP, n));
00506     Memcpy(REAL(VECTOR_ELT(ans, 3)), (double*)(resid->x), n);
00507 
00508     cholmod_l_free_factor(&L, &c);
00509     cholmod_l_free_dense(&rhs, &c);
00510     cholmod_l_free_dense(&resid, &c);
00511     cholmod_l_free_dense(&cAns, &c);
00512     UNPROTECT(1);
00513     return ans;
00514 }
00515 
00516 
00517 /* Define all of
00518  *  dgCMatrix_colSums(....)
00519  *  igCMatrix_colSums(....)
00520  *  lgCMatrix_colSums_d(....)
00521  *  lgCMatrix_colSums_i(....)
00522  *  ngCMatrix_colSums_d(....)
00523  *  ngCMatrix_colSums_i(....)
00524  */
00525 #define _dgC_
00526 #include "t_gCMatrix_colSums.c"
00527 
00528 #define _igC_
00529 #include "t_gCMatrix_colSums.c"
00530 
00531 #define _lgC_
00532 #include "t_gCMatrix_colSums.c"
00533 
00534 #define _ngC_
00535 #include "t_gCMatrix_colSums.c"
00536 
00537 #define _lgC_mn
00538 #include "t_gCMatrix_colSums.c"
00539 
00540 #define _ngC_mn
00541 #include "t_gCMatrix_colSums.c"
00542 
00543 
00544 SEXP lgCMatrix_colSums(SEXP x, SEXP NArm, SEXP spRes, SEXP trans, SEXP means)
00545 {
00546     if(asLogical(means)) /* ==> result will be "double" / "dsparseVector" */
00547         return lgCMatrix_colSums_d(x, NArm, spRes, trans, means);
00548     else
00549         return lgCMatrix_colSums_i(x, NArm, spRes, trans, means);
00550 }
00551 
00552 SEXP ngCMatrix_colSums(SEXP x, SEXP NArm, SEXP spRes, SEXP trans, SEXP means)
00553 {
00554     if(asLogical(means)) /* ==> result will be "double" / "dsparseVector" */
00555         return ngCMatrix_colSums_d(x, NArm, spRes, trans, means);
00556     else
00557         return ngCMatrix_colSums_i(x, NArm, spRes, trans, means);
00558 }
